results.content: Really good course, well phased and usefull!
results.content_html: Really good course, well phased and usefull!

results.content:
Not very deep explanation of things and concepts in Meteor itself. Some crucial features are contrary to the Meteor best practices at all, for example using Tracker to fetch data in React instead of createContainer https://guide.meteor.com/react.html
Often really hard to understand because of VERY VERY STRONG accent.
Intro and outro animations for each video are ridiculously long (over 10 seconds) and should be cut out entirely.

response.content:
Thanks for taking the time to write a review.

I would like to address some of your points. Because of the flow of the course, I start the app development using Tracker as you mention, but later on I introduce the concept of containers (using createContainer) to manage the data flow (lesson 79). You could argue that that is not a good practice, but I think it makes things easier to understand for most people, overall if they are just starting working with Meteor. In React, in general, you would like to use a "container approach (via Redux, or something else), but most courses start describing a simpler data flow before introducing Redux, or something else.

You also complain about my VERY VERY STRONG accent. I agree I have a strong accent and unfortunately I cannot do anything to fix that. My kids make jokes about my accent all the time. I submitted some lessons to some friends (native speakers and foreigners) before launching the course and in general they said they could understand my explanations. So, I am sorry you have a hard time understanding me. I posted 13 lessons that people can watch, plus the promotional video, without the need to buy the course. I think that should be enough to evaluate whether or not my accent is deal breaker.

Finally, you also complain about the intro and outro animations. I fully agree with you on that one. I thought that was cool and I spent some time creating and including them in the lessons. However, when reviewing a lesson (that was already published) that I had to edit, I realized the intros/outros were unnecessary.  So, why I haven't removed them, you may ask. Well, for two reasons: First, re uploading the lessons takes a lot of time (at Udemy's end); but most importantly, if i re-upload the lessons, Udemy will reset the user's history for the lessons modified. Hence, I thing once a student figures out that waiting 8 seconds to start a new lesson is too much, you can jump ahead those few seconds. For the outros, they just can ignore it all together. For new content or new courses I will take that as a lesson learned and avoid inclding intros/outros.
response.content_html:
Thanks for taking the time to write a review.

I would like to address some of your points. Because of the flow of the course, I start the app development using Tracker as you mention, but later on I introduce the concept of containers (using createContainer) to manage the data flow (lesson 79). You could argue that that is not a good practice, but I think it makes things easier to understand for most people, overall if they are just starting working with Meteor. In React, in general, you would like to use a "container approach (via Redux, or something else), but most courses start describing a simpler data flow before introducing Redux, or something else.

You also complain about my VERY VERY STRONG accent. I agree I have a strong accent and unfortunately I cannot do anything to fix that. My kids make jokes about my accent all the time. I submitted some lessons to some friends (native speakers and foreigners) before launching the course and in general they said they could understand my explanations. So, I am sorry you have a hard time understanding me. I posted 13 lessons that people can watch, plus the promotional video, without the need to buy the course. I think that should be enough to evaluate whether or not my accent is deal breaker.

Finally, you also complain about the intro and outro animations. I fully agree with you on that one. I thought that was cool and I spent some time creating and including them in the lessons. However, when reviewing a lesson (that was already published) that I had to edit, I realized the intros/outros were unnecessary. So, why I haven't removed them, you may ask. Well, for two reasons: First, re uploading the lessons takes a lot of time (at Udemy's end); but most importantly, if i re-upload the lessons, Udemy will reset the user's history for the lessons modified. Hence, I thing once a student figures out that waiting 8 seconds to start a new lesson is too much, you can jump ahead those few seconds. For the outros, they just can ignore it all together. For new content or new courses I will take that as a lesson learned and avoid inclding intros/outros.

results.content: First, whats with the Opener and Closer to each video, just a waste of time and lots of noise.  Second, his English is not very good, very hard to understand at times.  Third, his explanation as to how things work is useless.  "You load value and it does this", but why does it do that??? I'm not sure I will be able to get anything useful out of this lesson, but I will continue and see.
